definitions.definition: in the direction of something; towards something

examples.text: I walked to the office.
It fell to the ground.
It was on the way to the station.
He's going to Paris.
my first visit to Africa
He pointed to something on the opposite bank.
Her childhood was spent travelling from place to place.
The meadows lead down to the river.
Her hair fell to her waist.

definitions.definition: located in the direction mentioned from something

examples.text: Place the cursor to the left of the first word.
There are mountains to the north.

definitions.definition: used to show the person or thing that receives something

examples.text: He gave it to his sister.
I'll explain to you where everything goes.
I am deeply grateful to my parents.
Who did she address the letter to?
To whom did she address the letter?

definitions.definition: used to show the end or limit of a range or period of time

examples.text: a drop in profits from $105 million to around $75 million
I'd say he was 25 to 30 years old *(= approximately 25 or 30 years old)*.
I like all kinds of music from opera to reggae.
We only work from Monday to Friday.
I watched the programme from beginning to end.
How long is it to lunch?
It's five to ten *(= five minutes before ten o'clock)*.
The vegetables were cooked to perfection.
He tore the letter to pieces.
She sang the baby to sleep.
The letter reduced her to tears *(= made her cry)*.
His expression changed from amazement to joy.

definitions.definition: used to show the person or thing that is affected by an action

examples.text: She is devoted to her family.
What have you done to your hair?

definitions.definition: used to show that two things are attached or connected

examples.text: Attach this rope to the front of the car.

definitions.definition: used to show a relationship between one person or thing and another

examples.text: She's married to an Italian.
the Japanese ambassador to France
the key to the door
the solution to this problem
It was a threat to world peace.
She made a reference to her recent book.

definitions.definition: used to introduce the second part of a comparison or ratio

examples.text: I prefer walking to climbing.
The industry today is nothing to what it once was.
We won by six goals to three.

definitions.definition: used to show a quantity or rate

examples.text: There are 2.54 centimetres to an inch.
This car does 30 miles to the gallon.
a monument to the soldiers who died in the war
Let's drink to Julia and her new job.

definitions.definition: used to show somebody’s attitude or reaction to something

examples.text: His music isn't really to my taste.
To her astonishment, he smiled.

definitions.definition: used to show what somebody’s opinion or feeling about something is

examples.text: It sounded like crying to me.

definitions.definition: while something else is happening or being done

examples.text: He left the stage to prolonged applause.

definitions.definition: used after verbs of movement to mean ‘with the intention of giving something’

examples.text: People rushed to her rescue and picked her up.

wordOrigin: Old English tō (adverb and preposition), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch toe and German zu.
